snippet: The country’s lightly regulated casinos and tough bank secrecy laws had prompted warnings from the United States and money-laundering experts before the theft.
abstract: Investigation into theft of more than $80 million from Bangladesh's account at Federal Reserve Bank of New York points to weak financial oversight in the Philippines, particularly in its poorly-regulated casino industry; money appears to have been transferred to Philippine banks and then to casinos in laundering operation that took advantage of nation's highly secretive banking laws.

byline.original: By FLOYD WHALEY and NEIL GOUGH

lead_paragraph: The country’s lightly regulated casinos and tough bank secrecy laws had prompted warnings from the United States and money-laundering experts before the theft.

headline.main: Brazen Heist of Millions Puts Focus on the Philippines
headline.print_headline: A Heist of Millions, From a Nation

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
